Educational
Broadcasting
Review
June 21, 1968
Mr. James Fellows
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Ave., N. W.
Washington, D. C. 20036
Dear Jim:
Today i sent a letter off to Marcus Cohn telling him that l was
pleased that the two of you had decided to hire a special editor for
the monograph on the social revolution. Enclosed you will find two
articles that you sent me from the New York Times which ! am returning
since these may be of special interest to the new editor. Also, !
am sending along a manuscript from Ann Wilkens on closed circuit
television in the ghettos. It has definite possibilities for this
special issue.
While ! was recently in New York l talked with Russell Barber
about two programs that he is producing that seem rather unique In
reference to the problems of the Negro. Perhaps he should also be
contacted. Professors Lynch and Brooks are preparing a special article
on the communication curricula at Shaw University for Negro students.
Again, this material may fit in this issue.
Thanks again for your kind hospitality while i was recently in
Washington.
Sineerely
Allen E. Koenig
Editor
